Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Export Excel - number cells with 2 decimals" (#831) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Export Excel - number cells with 2 decimals

Is this a:
[x] Issue with the OpenXml library
[ ] Question on library usage

**Description**
I have a problem with excel export where I have numeric cells with 2 decimals.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Core 3.1.1
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.12

**Repro**
Here you can find a sample reproducing the issue.
[https://github.com/GiuliaMarradi/CreateExcel](url)
Just start the program and you can see excel produced C:\temp\output1.xlsx 

**Observed**
Cells with 1 decimal where a 0 should be added are not true numeric cells:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27773947/103620119-3a998c80-4f33-11eb-88ca-e3a990ba74ba.png)


Also when opening the excel I have this error, caused by those numeric but not numeric cells
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27773947/103620330-8fd59e00-4f33-11eb-98ba-d9bfaa6d3eda.png)

**Expected**
I found an example whose behavior should be: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27773947/103619767-9879a480-4f32-11eb-807b-e1de384f1cab.png)
In column B there are numeric cells with data where you can make sums and other operations.

I was inspired by this article from Codeproject (based on an older version of openxml library), but I wasn't able to get it work
https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/97307/Using-C-and-Open-XML-SDK-2-0-for-Microsoft-Office

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix bug: System.Xml.XmlException thrown when opening SDK-authored document containing an empty URI" (#835) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
* An empty string is a valid relative URI (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-4.2)
* System.IO.Packaging.InternalRelationshipCollection rejects empty `Target` attributes as the absence of a required attribute (https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/7ed93fa9211fcb8719fde13c540a46aa5b5d74fe/src/libraries/System.IO.Packaging/src/System/IO/Packaging/InternalRelationshipCollection.cs#L338-L340)
* Instead of throwing an exception and failing to open the file, provide users with the opportunity to rewrite empty URIs in the same manner as other invalid URIs

Resolves #834

Closed issue "Using OpenXmlElement.WriteTo(XmlWriter) is not reliable" (#832) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

The method `OpenXmlElement.WriteTo(XmlWriter)` internally uses `XmlWriter.WriteRaw(RawOuterXml)` when the XML of the element has not been parsed. Unfortunately, not all XmlWriter implementations support WriteRaw, so that one can get unexpected exceptions (with Heisenberg effect since debugging often causes the XML to be parsed) when invoking.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.12.0

**Repro**

```csharp
var run = new Run(@"<w:r xmlns:w=""http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main""><w:fldChar w:fldCharType=""begin"" /></w:r>");
var result = new XDocument();
using (var writer = result.CreateWriter()) {
    that.WriteTo(writer);
} // System.ArgumentException: Non white space characters cannot be added to content.
``` 

**Observed**

Writing to the XmlWriter causes an unexpected exception.

**Expected**

Xml is properly written to XmlWriter.

Opened issue "FieldCode (w:instrText) does not preserve whitespace" (#833) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

When using field codes with leading or trailing whitespace, the whitespace is lost.

This is a problem because it can cause problems with nested fields in Word, e.g. `{ IF { DATE }=...`

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.12.0

**Repro**

```csharp
var code = new FieldCode("IF ");
Trace.WriteLine(code.OuterXml);
``` 

**Observed**

```xml
<w:instrText xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main">IF </w:instrText>
```

**Expected**

```xml
<w:instrText xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main" xml:space="preserve">IF </w:instrText>
```
